channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Podcaster and author Mel Robbins opens up about her early failures
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Podcaster and author Mel Robbins opens up about her early failures.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. Podcaster and author Mel Robbins opens up about her early failures.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: Florida river becomes substitute site for sacred Hindu funeral tradition
item.description: The Ganges River in India is a final resting place for the ashes of loved ones. For those who can't make the journey, a river in Florida has become a substitute for the funeral tradition.
item.content:encoded: The Ganges River in India is a final resting place for the ashes of loved ones. For those who can't make the journey, a river in Florida has become a substitute for the funeral tradition.
item.dc:creator: Rose Schnabel

item.title: Frank Gehry, whose designs defied gravity and convention, dies at 96
item.description: Gehry transformed modern architecture with exuberant buildings such as the Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Guggenheim Museum. "I've always been for optimism and architecture not being sad," he said.
item.content:encoded:
Gehry transformed modern architecture with exuberant buildings such as the Walt Disney Concert Hall and the Guggenheim Museum. "I've always been for optimism and architecture not being sad," he said.

(Image credit: Dominieuq Faget)
item.dc:creator: Susan Stamberg

item.title: Horror, a Downton parody, and Sondheim on screen â€” in theaters this weekend
item.description: The Stephen Sondheim musical Merrily We Roll Along played to sold out crowds on Broadway during its 2023-2024 run. That show was filmed, and now available to watch on the big screen.
item.content:encoded:
The Stephen Sondheim musical Merrily We Roll Along played to sold out crowds on Broadway during its 2023-2024 run. That show was filmed, and now available to watch on the big screen.

(Image credit: Sony Pictures Classics)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Let 'The Secret Agent' fill you in on what it's like to live under a dictatorship
item.description: A research scientist is on the run from hitmen in this thrilling film. Set in 1977 Brazil, The Secret Agent captures the daily realities and surreal absurdities of life in an authoritarian state.
item.content:encoded: A research scientist is on the run from hitmen in this thrilling film. Set in 1977 Brazil, The Secret Agent captures the daily realities and surreal absurdities of life in an authoritarian state.
item.dc:creator: John Powers

item.title: Netflix will buy Warner Bros' studio and streaming businesses for $72 billion
item.description: The merger, announced Friday, would bring two of the industry's biggest players in film and TV under one roof. Beyond its television and motion picture division, Warner owns HBO Max and DC Studios.
item.content:encoded:
The merger, announced Friday, would bring two of the industry's biggest players in film and TV under one roof. Beyond its television and motion picture division, Warner owns HBO Max and DC Studios.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The Kennedy Center Honors are coming up. This year's event will be different
item.description: President Trump has made major changes at the Kennedy Center this year, ousting the board chair and president, and naming himself host of the organization's yearly awards show.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has made major changes at the Kennedy Center this year, ousting the board chair and president, and naming himself host of the organization's yearly awards show.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Remembering playwright and screenwriter Tom Stoppard
item.description: Stoppard, who died Nov. 29, wrote Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Real Thing, and the screenplays for Empire of the Sun and Shakespeare in Love. Originally broadcast in 1991.
item.content:encoded: Stoppard, who died Nov. 29, wrote Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead and The Real Thing, and the screenplays for Empire of the Sun and Shakespeare in Love. Originally broadcast in 1991.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Gen Z turns the quarter-zip into TikTok's coolest menswear staple
item.description: Gen Z guys are making the once-humble quarter-zip the newest breakout star on TikTok, turning the classic pullover into a buzzy fashion trend that's suddenly everywhere.
item.content:encoded: Gen Z guys are making the once-humble quarter-zip the newest breakout star on TikTok, turning the classic pullover into a buzzy fashion trend that's suddenly everywhere.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Libraries and museums get federal funding back after Trump cuts
item.description: Earlier this year, the Trump administration gutted the Institute of Museum and Library Services, leading to canceled federal grants. Now, after a court order, those grants are being reinstated.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this year, the Trump administration gutted the Institute of Museum and Library Services, leading to canceled federal grants. Now, after a court order, those grants are being reinstated.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Limbong
